description: On a Viking longship at sea, a large, formidable leader stands near the stern while several men row. Amidst the tired rowers, a smaller individual raises his hand with exaggerated cheerfulness to report a minor physical discomfort. The scene presents an ironic contrast between the expected stoicism and hardship of a Viking rower's life and the character's trivial complaint. This juxtaposition highlights the absurdism of focusing on a minor personal inconvenience in a seemingly dire or demanding collective situation.
caption: Yoo-hoo! Oh, yoo-hoo! ... I think I'm getting a blister.
